Title: Series: The Holy Land
Description: Title page Tinted lithograph with hand-colouring
Curator's comments: The titlepage of a nearly complete set of David Robert's book of which the full title is 'The Holy Land: Syria, Idumea, Arabia, Egypt & Nubia, from drawings made on the spot by David Roberts RA, with historical descriptions by the Rev. George Croly LLD, lithographed by Louis Haghe' (London, F.G.Moon, 1842). The plates were originally published uncoloured in 20 parts between 1842-5, and later reprinted coloured (tinted in one tint and hand-coloured for the rest). Abbey gives a full account of the history of the series. The BM set consists of the letterpress and 123 plates (of which one is a duplicate). Acquired bound in two volumes, it was then rebound in four. Each plate was given a separate register number. The order of the plates does not always follow that of Abbey, and two (Abbey 29 and 88) are lacking. Each plate (except 10) bears a cursive facsimile title in the plate, which often differ slightly from those given in the accompanying letterpress. Each plate is given a separate entry here, and the titles are those on the plate (which are also those given by Abbey). Part of the series was published separately in three volumes in 1846-1849, entitled 'Egypt and Nubia, / from drawings made on the spot by / David Roberts R.A. / With historical descriptions by / William Brockedon, F.R.S. / Lithographed by / Louis Haghe.', from which the BM has loose sheets in its collections.
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (385.2)
